009package GenericFilterDemos;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
013import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
014import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilterScalar;
015import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack.PixelSlice;
016import imagingbook.core.jdoc.JavaDocHelp;
017
018/**
019 * This ImageJ plugin shows how to construct a 3x3 custom generic filter based on class {@link GenericFilterScalar}.
020 * This plugin works for all types of images. On RGB color images, the filter is applied independently to the three
021 * color channels. The active image is modified.
022 *
023 * @author WB
024 * @version 2022/03/30
025 */
026public class Custom_Generic_Filter_Scalar implements PlugInFilter, JavaDocHelp {
027
028    public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus imp) {
029        return DOES_ALL;
030    }
031
032    public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {        
033        new ExampleFilterScalar3x3().applyTo(ip);
034    }
035    
036    // ------------------------------------------------------------------
037    
038    private static class ExampleFilterScalar3x3 extends GenericFilterScalar {
039        private final static float[][] H = {
040                        {1, 2, 1},
041                        {2, 4, 2},
042                        {1, 2, 1}};
043        
044        private final int width = 3;
045        private final int height = 3;
046        private final int xc = 1;
047        private final int yc = 1;
048        private final float s = 16;
049        
050        @Override
051                protected float doPixel(PixelSlice plane, int u, int v) {
052                float sum = 0;
053                for (int j = 0; j < height; j++) {
054                        int vj = v + j - yc;
055                        for (int i = 0; i < width; i++) {
056                                int ui = u + i - xc;
057                                sum = sum + plane.getVal(ui, vj) * H[i][j];
058                        }
059                }
060                return sum / s;
061        }
062
063    }
064
065}
